meanings.def: the thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid that rises to the top of milk, used in cooking or as a type of sauce to put on fruit, etc.
examples: We had strawberries and cream for dessert.
whipped cream
a dollop of fresh cream
scones with cream and jam
I asked for two coffees with cream.
Would you like milk or cream in your coffee?
(British English) cream cakes (= containing cream)
She piled great dollops of cream onto her apple pie.
This cream's gone off!
Whisk the cream and icing sugar together.

meanings.def: a sweet that has a soft substance like cream inside
examples: a chocolate/peppermint cream

meanings.def: a soft substance or thick liquid used on your skin to protect it or make it feel soft; a similar substance used for cleaning things
examples: moisturizing cream
Put a little antiseptic cream on the grazed skin.
a topical antibiotic cream
anti-wrinkle/anti-ageing cream
a cream cleaner

meanings.def: a pale colour between yellow and white
examples: Do you have this blouse in cream?
an eye-catching outfit of cream and black
a warm yellow shade of cream

meanings.def: the best people or things in a particular group
examples: the cream of New York society
the cream of the crop of this season’s movies
She looked like a cat that’s got the cream. She was almost purring with pleasure.

idioms.idiom: like a cat that’s got the cream
examples: She looked like a cat that’s got the cream. She was almost purring with pleasure.

meanings.def: between yellow and white in colour
examples: a cream linen suit
a cream carpet
The walls were cream and the ceiling was painted white.

meanings.def: to mix things together into a soft smooth mixture
examples: Cream the butter and sugar together.
We got creamed in the first round.
